{"step_by_step_thinking": "The centric holding cusp is the cusp that makes the primary contact with the opposing tooth in centric occlusion. In the case of the molars, the mesiobuccal cusp of the maxillary first molar and the mesiolingual cusp of the mandibular first molar are the ones that make this primary contact.", "answer_choice": "B. Mesiolingual cusp of mandibular first molar"}
